verses.verse: Manasseh <S%H4519><s%> was twelve <S%H8147><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old <S%H1121><s%> when he began to reign <S%H4427><s%>; and he reigned <S%H4427><s%> five <S%H2568><s%> and fifty <S%H2572><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> in Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>: and his mother <S%H517><s%>'s name <S%H8034><s%> was Hephzibah <S%H2657><s%>.

And he built <S%H1129><s%> altars <S%H4196><s%> for all the host <S%H6635><s%> of heaven <S%H8064><s%> in the two <S%H8147><s%> courts <S%H2691><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>.

And he made his son <S%H1121><s%> to pass <S%H5674><s%> through the fire <S%H784><s%>, and practised augury <S%H6049><s%>, and used enchantments <S%H5172><s%>, and dealt <S%H6213><s%> with them that had familiar spirits <S%H178><s%>, and with wizards <S%H3049><s%>: he wrought <S%H6213><s%> much <S%H7235><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> in the sight <S%H5869><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, to provoke him to anger <S%H3707><s%>.

But they hearkened <S%H8085><s%> not <S%H4519><s%>: and Manasseh seduced <S%H8582><s%> them to do <S%H6213><s%> that which is evil <S%H7451><s%> more than did the nations <S%H1471><s%> whom Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> destroyed <S%H8045><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>.

therefore thus saith <S%H559><s%> Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, the God <S%H430><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, Behold <S%H935><s%>, I bring such evil <S%H7451><s%> upon Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> and Judah <S%H3063><s%>, that whosoever heareth <S%H8085><s%> of it <S%H8147><s%>, both his ears <S%H241><s%> shall tingle <S%H6750><s%>.

And I will cast off <S%H5203><s%> the remnant <S%H7611><s%> of mine inheritance <S%H5159><s%>, and deliver <S%H5414><s%> them into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of their enemies <S%H341><s%>; and they shall become a prey <S%H957><s%> and a spoil <S%H4933><s%> to all their enemies <S%H341><s%>;

because they have done <S%H6213><s%> that which is evil <S%H7451><s%> in my sight <S%H5869><s%>, and have provoked <S%H4480><s%> me to anger <S%H3707><s%>, since the day <S%H3117><s%> their fathers <S%H1><s%> came forth <S%H3318><s%> out of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, even unto this day <S%H3117><s%>.

Moreover Manasseh <S%H4519><s%> shed <S%H8210><s%> innocent <S%H5355><s%> blood <S%H1818><s%> very <S%H3966><s%> much <S%H7235><s%>, till he had filled <S%H4390><s%> Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> from one end <S%H6310><s%> to another <S%H6310><s%>; besides his sin <S%H2403><s%> wherewith he made Judah <S%H3063><s%> to sin <S%H2398><s%>, in doing <S%H6213><s%> that which was evil <S%H7451><s%> in the sight <S%H5869><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>.

Now the rest <S%H3499><s%> of the acts <S%H1697><s%> of Manasseh <S%H4519><s%>, and all that he did <S%H6213><s%>, and his sin <S%H2403><s%> that he sinned <S%H2398><s%>, are they not written <S%H3789><s%> in the book <S%H5612><s%> of the chronicles <S%H1697><s%> of the kings <S%H4428><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%>?

And Manasseh <S%H4519><s%> slept <S%H7901><s%> with his fathers <S%H1><s%>, and was buried <S%H6912><s%> in the garden <S%H1588><s%> of his own house <S%H1004><s%>, in the garden <S%H1588><s%> of Uzza <S%H5798><s%>: and Amon <S%H526><s%> his son <S%H1121><s%> reigned in his stead <S%H4427><s%>.

Amon <S%H526><s%> was twenty <S%H6242><s%> and two <S%H8147><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old <S%H1121><s%> when he began to reign <S%H4427><s%>; and he reigned <S%H4427><s%> two <S%H8147><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> in Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>: and his mother <S%H517><s%>'s name <S%H8034><s%> was Meshullemeth <S%H4922><s%> the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Haruz <S%H2743><s%> of Jotbah <S%H3192><s%>.
